author: Carolynn Snow
text: 'I don’t know about their food but we went in just for hot cocoa because it was cold outside.  We got warm milk.  They offered to make them again but it wasn’t any better the second time.  They said we’d have to sweeten them.  Sweeten hot cocoa??  Anyway
column5: tossed them down the street.  So disappointed!! ☹️'

author: Rosa Irizarry
text: 'Fresh bakery
column5: excellent coffee. Great service
column6: friendly.'

author: Sandra Doussin
text: 'I love Choc O Pain! Their items are always  delicious and high quality! The customer service I received on a very busy Saturday morning was great!!! Kudos to the staff!! 👏🏻👏🏻👏🏻'

author: Chime Youtso
text: 'Nice place'

author: Kyle
text: 'Amazing baked goods!'

author: Go Fishing
text: 'Very nice place! The best croissants and delicious coffee 💜'

author: Anuj Mittal
text: 'Try their almost 🥐. One of the best you will have'

author: Helen Destefano
text: 'Great experience hade gift card from COVID and they honored them the manager was great and the staff coffee and croissant delicious'

author: Uygar Yilmaz
text: "I've only been here twice
column5: so this may just be my bad luck
column6: but so far I haven't been able to have fresh croissants. They always taste like leftovers from the previous day."

author: Marine Havel
text: 'Wow! Loved the atmosphere upstairs
column5: and the madeleines! The macarons are just sublime. I need to come back and try their bread now.'

author: Alberto Navarro
text: "The bakery is so good. You cannot go wrong with any choice of their selection of pastries. I don't go very often as I live far from them. My only but is that they are small and the service tends to be a bit slow. Other than that
column5: they are very friendly
column6: and the food is excellent."

author: Louis Mannarino
text: 'Excellent Food and Dessert!\nExcellent Service!\nA favorite is Quiche Lorraine
column5: whether a personal size for lunch or the larger size for dinner...always delicious and filled with bacon!\nThe desserts are a delicious treat for a weekend breakfast!'

author: Svet
text: 'My go to place for coffee and baked goods on the weekends. Best croissants in the area - always fresh and tasty!'

author: Jamie P
text: 'Great selection of pastries and sandwiches.'

author: Arash Dadvand
text: 'This place is poorly managed
column5: over priced and they don’t even bake their bakery in store\nLet’s start with management
column6: they do not make everything fresh. For example the pies are their from days before until they are being sold. Even Panera bread donates the remaining bakery at the end of the day!!\nAnother example of rip off is I just ordered a large latte. There is a chalkboard that has the price for 4.75. When the I wanted to pay suddenly the price was $6+ tips. I asked isn’t that the price the man said that is the price before Covid!!\nThe next day I bought the same latte and the price was 5.50+ tips!!!!'

author: Roshun Sangani
text: "I can't say enough good things about Choc O Pain! As you walk in you immediately are greeted with an extremely aesthetically pleasing establishment and display of their variety of baked goods/sandwiches. The staff are extremely nice and friendly and it is clear that they take pride in their store (as they should). I have had the luxury of trying a variety of items from here including their sandwiches
column5: fresh bread and baked goods. I can honestly say that I have yet to try something that I did not like. Now I am by no means an expert on bakeries
column6: but I have had my share of freshly baked goods in Europe and the US alike and Choc o Pain is easily going toe to toe with some of the best I've had. Please do yourself a favor and give this place a try."

author: Dominique Bession
text: 'Very good authentic French bakery.'

author: Eugenia Pietsukh
text: 'Beautiful place and delicious croissants!'

author: Anna Honey
text: 'Beautiful bakery with fresh bread
column5: pastries
column6: sandwiches
column7: drinks

author: Stephanie Thao Tran-Chong
text: 'Baguettes were very good but I was a bit disappointed in the bread selection. Maybe due to COVID so there wasn’t much put out on display'

author: Joseph S
text: 'Came in and ruined my waistline with a yummy choc au pain. Was happy to have it fully cooked compared to one I received from the location in Jersey City off Grove St. Will return to this one though never again to the other.'

author: Amanda Shirley
text: "This place has the best baked goods! Highly recommend the apple turnover. You'll be so happy to have one! Also
column5: the staff is top notch!"

author: Jonathan Petrakakos
text: 'I just moved to Hoboken and have been here everyday since! The two women who work in the mornings are very friendly and provide great service. It is worth stopping in for the smell alone!'

author: Julie Kae
text: 'Best lemonade I have ever had. The raspberry cakes were also amazing.'

author: Eva Haynes
text: 'This was my first time here.  The young African American lady on the morning shift on Wednesday March 10
column5: was EXCEPTIONAL. She was very friendly and engaging. Thank you. If you are ever in Hoboken and you need a smile from a friendly face
column6: this is the place you want to come for delightful service.'

author: Agan Singh
text: 'Choc O Pain has the best croissants I have ever had. My favorite is the chocolate almond. I also highly suggest special ordering any of their pies'

author: Leah Holton
text: 'On par with Europe
column5: California and some of the best bakeries in NYC. Good variety
column6: toothsome crusts
column7: the bread is nicely airy with balanced gluten. Their sourdoughs are intense without going overboard - which I judge as perfect. Anytime I’m in Hoboken
column8: I’m sure to hit this spot for at least a petit kouign amann

author: Caleb King
text: 'Delicious treats
column5: great coffee
column6: and awesome staff. If you are looking for anything from a baguette
column7: chocopain
column9: or more this is a must-stop kind of place. I love nothing more than waking up and grabbing a latte and chocolate croissant from Choc O Pain to start my day.'

author: Janice Fredericks
text: 'Excellent service
column5: excellent food. Highly recommend'

author: Melissa Torres
text: 'The food and drink were fine... service today from the young woman
column5: not so much. Had an attitude from start to finish. As we were waiting for our drinks and other customers came in
column6: she said in a very condescending tone “can you like
column7: move down
column8: so that they can look? Just move”. A testament of its not what you say

author: Romain Eslier
text: 'I ordered a pear almond tart for Christmas’ eve and was definitely disappointed. The dough was not well prepared
column5: not enough cooked and with no taste at all.. In addition
column6: the “frangipane” was nothing like the one in the galette des rois. There was too much cinnamon to have a tasty almond pear. I won’t buy it again. I bought although 2 baguettes
column7: and could not eat the rest of it
column8: the day after as it was completely dry and too hard to eat except if you want to loose a tooth with a bite. Very disappointed experience. I won’t return to this place for sure !'

author: JIGAR DOSHI
text: 'Best croissant in Hoboken'

author: Edward Monero
text: 'Best croissant in Hoboken'

author: Chris Shimmin
text: 'Great assortment of pastries and breads. The almond croissant is 🔥aka delicious.'

author: Irina Zavelevich
text: "I wasn't my first time visiting this place
column5: and every time it's great"

author: Mark Boyles
text: 'Expensive but good'

author: Nancy Chung
text: 'The staff
column5: service
column6: atmosphere and space make this place.\nCoffee is 3/5 for me
column7: but the staff friendliness
column8: space and the delicious food make up for it.   Always a great time going here!'

author: Hemant T
text: 'Always enjoy this place. Great for meeting people for lunch or brunch even an evening coffee. Service is usually good. Coffee is good. A little pricey but that is to be expected for Hoboken.'

author: Aneesha Krishnakumar
text: "Don't leave this place without trying their almond croissant!"

author: dina zohar
text:
'(Translated by Google) Quick service Delicious clean place and warm atmosphere

(Original)
שרות מהיר מקום נקי טעים ואווירה חמה'

author: Shiv Sankar
text: 'Wonderful bakery and coffee shop!  There is a great area upstairs for little ones to play in
column5: as well
column6: during the winter and on a rainy day!'

author: Joshua Laryea
text: 'Great pastries and lots of room upstairs to work and meet up. It was a bit loud upstairs when I was there on a Sunday afternoon due  to kids playing. I definitely would go back!'

author: Victor Manuel Gonzalez
text: 'Good service
column5: good food'

author: Chris
text: 'Great little French bakery. They’re even the only place anywhere near the city that sells Vegan Croissants and Vegan Pain au chocolat.\n\nThey also have an awesome little upstairs. Great if you have kids!'

author: Stacie J.
text: 'Delish! Everything is scrumptious!'

author: Luis NV
text: '(Translated by Google) `Beautiful coffee
column5: with an ideal first floor
column6:
with sofas and playground and reading for children. Coffee and chocolate croissants and almedra ... brutal.

`Precioso café

column8: con sofás y zona de juegos y lectura para niños. el café y los croasanes de chocolate y almedra... brutales.'

author: willie toxtle
text: 'Good place to start the day!!'

author: Kathleen O'Hara
text: 'Coffee
column5: breakfast or afternoon snack this place is a must stop.'

author: Mah Rezaa
text: 'Great small bakery and coffee or tea. You can get bread or tasty pastries. There are not many tables and some stay long. I think it would be great to have more tables or separate laptop people from the rest.'

author: Ludovic MASSON
text: "Really good bakery !! As a French
column5: I recommend this place for the baguette
column6: croissant and other bakery. As good as in France !\nAlso
column7: it's the time for galette des rois (King's cake) and they are really good !!\nUpstair is so cost
column8: I like to stay !\nGo for it 👍🏼"

author: Dani T
text: 'I\'ve had some very delicious and flaky croissants in my life
column5: and I expected to have another good one here. Being that they are a "french" place I was excited to have my expectations met. However when I bit into my croissant it was not layered enough
column6: and the inside was chewy. Definitely
column7: in no way was their croissant even a smidge similar to an authentic delish flaky

author: Arun Warrier
text: 'Very good french bakery . We like most items on the menu here'

author: Judy Hsiung
text: 'Had to get the almond croissant
column5: it was perfectly sweet and almost creamy like in center but crunchy outside which I love. Cant wait to come back when I visit again.'

author: Serena Borrelli
text: 'I needed to order a breakfast for my brother birthday
column5: but as I live in Europe I could not make contact directly with the shop. So I emailed them and Clemence replied and assisted me in everything I needed. He was very kind and definetly went the extra mile! I am very happy of the service I have received. The breakfast delivery was punctual
column6: everything was delicious and fresh. My brother was very happy of it
column7: so do I. Thank you again!'

author: Jeanie Daly
text: 'Great spot for breakfast and coffee!'

author: Ed Moore
text: 'Black bean and corn soup was very good. Baked goodies were delicious. Service is friendly and efficient.'

author: Adrian Salcedo
text: 'Been here many times. Love the chocolate croissants. Will keep coming back.'

author: Amer ALKAHWAJI
text: 'Disappointing and pricy'

author: Lala I
text: 'Delish - staff needs a bit more training'

author: LaRissa U
text: 'Very good breakfast pastries. Avocado toast is excellent but takes awhile to make.'

author: Za M
text: 'Great'

author: Nicholas Tomaselli
text: 'Good French pastries. The chocolate croissant is very good. The lemonade is very natural and sour. I personally love it but it is not for everyone.'

author: Robert K. Chin
text: "wanted to see what the fuss was about in regards to people complaining about the croissants.   the time of baking to time of purchase also says a lot.  I purchased a croissant around 3pm.  croissants are yeasty breads so chewiness is normal
column5: also depends on how long they proof the dough
column6: the type of flour used
column7: and how wet the dough is
column8: how much water is in the butter
column10: that all affects overall product.   the croissant was merely ok
column11: i felt the inside of my croissant was a bit wet
column13: and wasn't well laminated (Butter and flour layers). I think also most small american bakeries don't have a dough sheeting machine as these are expensive
column14: so trying to make a croissant by hand rolling or however you can to make thin sheets of butter and dough will result in a not so perfect croissant.  they did use butter
column17: and the dough was probably a tad too wet."

author: Doreen Sarnowski
text: 'Best chocolate croissants.   Cozy and relaxing💓'

author: Wallstreet X
text: "The Ham and Cheese Croissants here are next level - Make sure to order it toasted. it's buttery and just an 11 out 10 if you're having a bad day just order one and you'll re think life. lol.\n\nReasonably priced for Hoboken and friendly staff - great environment"

author: Jen
text: 'My mocha was unpleasantly hot and didn’t taste great (I’m fine if it’s not sweet chocolate
column5: but this was just bad) but the food was okay. We sat upstairs and it was filthy and rather than looking like a little French dolls house
column6: it looked as though it was just full of someone’s discarded mismatching furniture. They didn’t turn on the music until we’d been up there an hour. Please make time for your staff to clean! The stairs looked like they hadn’t been swept/mopped in a week. Huge pile of boxes in the hall
column7: too. Just felt like we were in someone’s home but in a ‘sorry

author: Hen Pastry Chef
text: "Super nice place and super delicious.\nIf you are looking for place to work
column5: read a book or meeting you friend for coffee this is your place. This place is nice
column6: you have upper floor with tables and sofas.\nAlso everything is super delicious the bakery  and the menu for lunch soup and sandwiches. There are also a lot of vegan lunch options.\nAnd the nicest part you have french music in the background. You don't want to miss this place."

author: Vlad D.
text: 'Great coffee and bakery
column5: soups and light lunches.\nAlso great service
column6: small french plates'

author: Kim Mattappallil
text: "Every pastry I've had has been delicious"

author: Natali Gonzalez
text: "Decent food
column5: we've tried several baked goods and they were good but not great. Pricing is comparable to NYC prices
column6: which always bothers me but that's hoboken overall."

author: Marie Escaped
text: 'Tasty but dirty'

author: Valerie Yeo
text: "Nice bakery in Hoboken that serve up fantastic pastries. The Palmier is amazing not to forget their crispy croissant. I personally like their quiche and flourless chocolate cake too. The baguette and ciabatta is great as well. I'm always there for to go. Would love to try their sandwiches and hot chocolate the next round. 2 locations at Hoboken making it very convenient to grab breakfast for little bud and me. Always 💯 service quality."

author: zachary huston
text: 'Amazing bakery'

author: William Colon
text: 'Excellent service
column5: Or family celebrated our twin 44 bday there n the room n service were impeccable. Food all of it was superb.'

author: Laura Costa
text:
'(Translated by Google) great cafeteria

(Original)
Ótima cafeteria'

author: Mr. Bhatt
text:
'Loved the place!

Choc O Pain is a small and chic bakery with a wide variety of pastries and breads. They serve quality food here and is priced right.

It has french music playing in the background and is running just about busy and not too overcrowded.

Ordered black bean soup
column5: flourless chocolate cake and espresso mocha and everything was great.'

author: Mor Dery
text: 'Amazing soups and pastries. Love it that you can bring your toddler to the second floor and keep them entertained there'

author: Sean Erfurt
text: 'Disappointing. Waiter forgot a dish (which didn’t even need heating) until we went up to ask for it. Croque-Monsieur came out very burnt
column5: and tea was scalding hot. It wasn’t even a busy day.'

author: Narayanan V
text: 'Great place to work and play area for kids on top'

author: Roxy Menhaji
text:
'(Translated by Google) Best pain au chocolat around!

(Original)
Best pain au chocolat around!'

author: Hauke Vagts
text: 'Heavenly French pastries
column5: try the petit kouign\xa0(raspberry is best) or the almond croissant. Everything else is good too. A bit pricey
column6: but it the best croissants in Hoboken. They also have an area for kids to play upstairs.'

author: Martha Lucia Guerendeain
text:
'Overpriced
1 ice coffee
I sandwich croissants
1 small piece of apple tart
$19.75'

author: Alejandra Ibarra
text: 'Very good coffee and croissants but the music is not the best in all of the locations.'

author: Jonathan Almeida
text: "Probably my favourite bakery/coffee shop in Hoboken to visit. Everyone goes to Carlos because of the name
column5: but this is a really quaint little gem in a not so noisy corner.\n\nAlternatively
column6: there's a second location as well on the other side of Hoboken as well if that might be closer.\n\nTry the Almond croissants if you're not sure what you want."

author: Linda Samuels
text: 'The lunch is terrible here.\n\nOverpriced
column5: mostly bread
column6: sandwiches. The orzo is just bad.'

author: Diane Johnson
text: 'The pain au chocolat managed to be both overcooked and too chewy. The German bakery on Washington Street was much better. They do have a great seating area upstairs with books and toys for kids.'

author: Chris Walker
text: "What's not to like."

text: 'Nice place to sit for a long time.\nUpstairs has stuff for kids to play.'

text: 'Excellent pastries and breads'

author: IRINA BURGHARDT
text: 'oh man all good but the lemonade and ice tea are poison! lemnade is made of the lemon concentrate and is super sour and awful. Ice tea is washed
column5: no taste no flavor just water with 1 tea bag... please improve it please'

author: JW
text: 'Great espresso drinks and a variety of pastries'

author: Alan Klayman
text: 'Friendly
column5: warm
column6: coffee shop.  A little pricey.'

author: Samah Benali
text: 'Delicious! I am from Belgium and until now I had to go to the city to find decent bread/croissants for my breakfast. I just discovered the place and I am so happy I can find such quality of French bread and croissants in Hoboken! Thank you!'

author: Alan
text: 'Ordered a dozen chocolate croissants for pickup
column5: and they gave me 7 vanilla ones. Croissants are good though.'

text: 'Authentic french pastries
column5: wonderfully prepared. The only downside to the place is that service is sometimes a bit slow and chaotic'

author: Sam K
text: 'Delicious baked goods
column5: coffee and tea. Great spot for a quick breakfast
column6: lunch or midday snack.\n\nWell worth the wait
column7: but be prepared to wait as they seemed under staffed the few times I have been there.'

author: Anna Kassymova
text: 'Aaa! Great place
column5: you can eat your tongue!))) try french meringue and choco-almond croissant)))'

author: Jeannie Shubitz
text: 'Love this place. The chocolate almond croissant is beyond delicious! Add to that the playroom upstairs for parents and kids

text: 'Not just a bakery... To me is a to learn new things.'

author: Mrunmai Javalgekar
text: 'Casual place to hangout. Good coffee.'

author: Catherine Mino
text: 'Excellent chocolate croissant! However they need to teach the staff what a Cortado is...got some espresso with cold milk.'

text: 'upscale french cafe. the bread is banging!! besides that its a bit snobby. i like the one in the heights. but that place is snobby too. but again

text: 'Nice and warm place where to take a break during the day and a good breakfast in the morning. Fantastic French bread also!!'

text:
"(Translated by Google) It is an extra place where you can have a French breakfast without hesitation

Le personnel sympa et ils font des efforts pour parler français."

author: delete account
text: 'Great pastries
column5: great staff'

author: Mauricio Lopez
text: 'The food and drinks we ordered were great. We really did feel a bit like in France or Montreal even as the staff were reviewing how to pronounce the menu. Service was good as well.'

author: Patrick Mueller
text: 'Ordered a decaf coffee
column5: but they served me caffeinated instead. I asked if they were sure it was decaf since it sure didn’t taste like it and they said it was
column6: that it was a decaf dark roast. Well
column7: that’s odd because 20 hours later
column8: I’m still wide awake and unable to sleep this evening. Thanks Choc O Pain. Will never step foot in your door again.'

author: Jerry Lore
text: "I love their rustic downtown spot
column5: so many options to pick! I normally grab a la columns double espresso cortado with the $3.20 financiers (gluten-free) but their croissants $2.90
column6: kouigns $3.35 and Banana Creme tarte $6.75 are amazing! They do accept Apple Pay and they’ve gender neutral restrooms. Best bakery in town and a wonderful staff can't wait to see thew new store open on 15th street by the Tea Building
column7: Enjoy!"

author: Gene Levin
text: "This is a pretty reliable stop for baked goods
column5: especially baguettes and kouign-amanns.  They also make some pretty good soups and sandwiches
column6: though selection is limited
column7: and there's a pretty laid back seating area upstairs.  It's a nice place to hang out and maybe even get some work done."

author: Jean Baptiste Allard
text: 'I feel like being in my home country
column5: thanks Chocopain!!!'

author: Jake Redman
text: 'Decent pastries
column5: okay coffee. Great spot for kids upstairs.'

author: Bill Fisher
text: 'The croissant and the coffee latte was delicious !! Definitely a place to stop!!'

author: Andrew Canning
text: 'The good: the food is usually good. The bad: they always burn the lattes and cappuccino’s (about 6 times in a row over the course of a year)
column5: place can become a zoo with cleanliness being neglected
column6: service is hit or miss.'

text: 'Very cozy atmosphere and good coffee.. handmade French pastry..'

column5: if not just a tad over baked. The outdoor tables are nice for people watching. The staff is very friendly and efficient.'

text: 'awesome pastries!'

column5: croissants
column6: cafe espresso
column7: sandwich jambon beurre with cornichons even French songs...Fells like to be in France!\nI love this place so much!'

author: Stephen Gualano
text: 'A place I consider
column5: Heaven on Earth!!\n\nSuperior Service
column6: Soothing Atmosphere & Scrumptious Food!!'

author: Thang Ung
text: 'Nice quiet place to sneak off to have a small bite.'

author: Dom Benzo
text: 'Top quality pastries
column5: very good coffee and excellent service.'

author: José López
text: 'The bread is good but there is no AC and could be really hot'

author: Andres Egoavil
text: 'Very friendly staff
column5: great coffee and pastries in this lovely french bakery'

author: Sharlys Leszczuk
text: "I've never had a bad pastry here. My favorite is the berry kouign!"

author: Humberto Servello
text: 'Good bakery and café with tables occupied by people with their laptops lingering around forever.'

author: Gina Brill
text: 'You must try the chocolate almond croissants!'

author: Alyssa Russek
text: 'Great service great pastries. Never a bad time going here'

author: Rachel Wranosky
text: 'French macarons...great texture
column5: super flavor!'

author: Erdem
text: 'Great coffee and food.'

author: Guillaume Guy
text: "Definitely my favorite bakery in Hoboken. Espresso are great
column5: pastries are delicious (croissants + chocolate croissants + Kouign [buy 3 for $8] ). I also bought their delicious quiches and pies for parties and they were all appreciated.\nAlso
column6: try out their bread (campaign loaf). It's pricey but really high quality (lots of nuts) and fresh."

author: E Son
text: 'This is a baby friendly cafe which makes decent coffee and fresh yummy baking goods. All staffs are nice and friendly
column5: and the cafe looks always clean.'

author: Alex Milan
text: "I just had one of the best pastries I've ever tasted.  It was a round compressed croissant filled with apple.  Soo good!!"

author: debra rodriguez
text: 'Great restaurant and a true Persian experience. Authentic food with attentive service. Reservation is essential in high season.'

author: James Chen
text: 'Love this place although it can get VERY crowded on the weekend!'

author: Eric Lampi
text: "Love this place. Go early
column5: and the croissants are still warm and crispy! They bread is excellent. It's been such a nice addition to the neighborhood."

author: Adriana Freixa
text: 'Delicious pastry and coffee. Plus
column5: her top floor is a hidden gem in Hoboken if you have kids!'

author: Mike Reid
text: 'Good croissants and coffee'

author: John Sama
text: 'Good coffee and pastries. The service can be painfully slow at times and the staff has a tendency to be arrogant
column5: sometimes borderline obnoxious.'

author: thibault couture
text: 'Best place in Hoboken'

author: Monica Dema
text: "This was my second time in the shop
column5: and I fell in love again. I can't believe it's been >2 years since my last visit
column6: but I can honestly say it won't be another two before my return. The cappuccino and petit kouign were a match made in Parisian heaven."

author: Ángela Guzman
text: "I like the ambiance of the store and the tarts are good. But employees can be rude.  The bread is good but it goes bad after a few hrs
column5: the hot chocolate is water diluted (non sweetened is a plus) but it doesn't taste anything like chocolate
column6: the coffe is not good. I'm really disappointed for a French bakery."

author: Pieter Sommen
text: 'Excellent bread and pastries.  The staff behind the counter is often discombobulated
column5: but friendly.'

author: Andrea Ruz
text: 'Delicious!'

author: Sean Johnson
text: 'Great place for a pastry and coffee in Hoboken. Line is sometimes frustratingly long
column5: but usually worth it. Great space upstairs for kids.'

author: WoodenRoller
text: "Rustic little shop with upstairs seating at large communal tables. Selection is great and the pastries are heavenly. A bit on the expensive side but you won't regret it!"

author: Rokotoff
text: 'Nice place!!!'

author: Ming Lai
text: 'Good French pastries'

author: Balazs Kocsis
text: 'Great french bakery'

author: Elizabeth Markham
text: 'Pricy but good bakery.'

author: Mandi Abdalla Hernandez-Jimenez
text: 'They take LevelUp but never give any free credit for the first time like every other place does
column5: rewards on coffee & drinks or any loyalty  reward amount after spending $50-$100 even though they are somewhat expensive. Also
column6: wifi is semi reliable and bread is some times stale. :(\nAlso
column7: it gets pretty rowdy with all the adorable children for they sometimes throw birthday parties there...at a French cafe!??\nBut! Delicious pastries
column9: big selection and most of the time wonderful staff.\n3 1/2 stars as an avid LevelUp user'

author: Sharon Hurley Hall
text: 'Loved the atmosphere
column5: the asparagus quiche
column6: the pain au chocolat and the macchiato. Great way to start the morning.'

author: Al Villar
text: 'This is a small piece of Paris in Hoboken
column5: I love it and so will you.'

author: Andrew Stranovsky
text: 'So nice to have this in the neighborhood.  Open early
column5: great coffee and pastries.'

author: Jonathan Arrabito
text: 'I like the ambiance and the whole idea of this place.  It definitely reminds me of some cafes in Paris.  The pastries are phenomenal.  They were a huge hit whenever I would bring them into work.  I highly recommend them.'

author: Drew Pronko
text: 'French bakery/café with a large selection of pastries and baked goods. Take your food and drink upstairs for a quiet place to work or catch up with friends.'

author: Jim Mannoia
text: 'Upstairs is a great place to hang out
column5: and actually kid friendly!'

author: Andrea Gonzalez
text: 'Terrible. Owner and staff are RUDE! Save yourself the trip. I am talking about the one in Hoboken. Over priced. Coffee tastes like water...'

author: Ellie Chin
text: "This place is good but not the best bakery I've ever been to. It's also way too overpriced! For the price I was thinking it was going to some amazing bakery that would have me wanting to crawl back to the place."

author: Nicolas Beck
text: 'I am French and I can tell you that this is by far the best French bakery I have found on this side of the Atlantic. The pastries and breads are delicious but somewhat over priced. The one improvement they could I believe make is to make sure the taste/quality of their different batches of pastries they serve throughout the day remains the same'

author: Alejandra Villarreal
text: 'Owner and staff very rude! If potty trainning was one of the worst experiences in my life with kids
column5: Choc O Pain was worst! 👎🏻👎🏻👎🏻'

author: Marie F. Ovejas
text: 'Worst customers experience ever !! The owner is extremely rude.'

author: M G
text: 'They have great selection.\nVery clean. Fast service. They need to work on their friendliness.\nQuiche Lorraine is really delicious!'

author: David Bledin
text: 'Very decent
column5: a bit pricey for what it is'

author: Diana García
text: "I've been going to this cafe for two years and everything I've had here has been absolutely delicious. They have
column5: in my opinion
column6: the best pastries in town. It doesn't hurt that they are super nice and they have a little kids area upstairs so mum can enjoy her coffee while the babies have fun."

author: Robert Bennett
text: 'Great place!! Great Bread!!'

author: Michael Pereira
text: 'A real French experience in the US. Great to hang out with kids in the upper level.'

author: Keith Walters
text: 'Have a chocolate almond croissant!'

author: Wen Lui
text: "The latte I had was good
column5: but I was disappointed by the almond chocolate croissant. It was cold and dense and not as flaky or crisp as the reviews I read.\n\nBut
column6: it's a great place to study/get some work done--check out the second floor of the cafe. It has a sky light that lets natural light in
column7: nice comfy couches and some large communal tables. A nice hideaway from the bustle of the streets/incoming customers downstairs. A warning though: there's also a kids area up here
column8: so if you can't deal with external distraction/noise you might want to stick to the downstairs area

author: Philippe Bazin
text: 'Excellent French boulangerie. I live nearby and I stop regularly to buy a baguette. The quiche lorraine is also very good.'

author: Joanne Pham
text: "I work in Hoboken and was looking for a place with sweets that weren't too sweet or over priced. Carlos' Bakery is over priced and their baked goods are disgusting. My coworker recommended this place. Not only was the girl who helped me …"

author: Shaun McCarthy
text: "The chocolate croissants are amazing. They have a great seating area upstairs with a playmat
column5: and it's quiet / private enough for breastfeeding during a weekday."

author: Maria NS
text: "Choc O Pain adds a little je ne sais quoi to 1st Street.  Even when I'm not buying anything
column5: I love that it's there.  The street just feels happier for it.  Choc O Pain is pricey but always bustling.  Last week I ordered an apricot tart …"

author: Mehmet E Basbug
text: 'We had spinach goat cheese quiche
column5: macaroons(salty caramel
column6: coffee
column7: chocolate
column8: pistachio) and cafe au lait. Quiche was great
column9: caramel and pistachio macaroons were delicious
column10: chocolate and coffee macaroons were ok and the coffee was good …'

author: Zocy K
text: 'Excellent French pastries and coffee. Not cheap
column5: but worth the money.'

author: Jake VanderKamp
text: "The best chocolate croissant this side of the Atlantic
column5: and their chocolate bread pudding made my knee's give out a little. This place is legit."
